Wow.  Total code review fail on our part.

Can you log a high-priority bug?=
  We'll smash this bug for 4.7,
possibly next week's snapshot.  If you feel=
 really motivated and are
skilled in git, feel free to submit a patch.  Tha=
nks for keeping us
honest,

   David Saff

On Thu, Apr 30, 2009 at 1:25 PM,=
 mghongslo <mghongslo@...> wrote:
> I'm reviewing the experimental fu=
nctionality of running parallel tests at the class level; i.e. Parallel.cla=
sses(), I notice in the ParallelComputer class, run() method there is a cal=
l get with a timeout for 2000 milliseconds. Is there a significant reason f=
or this versus get() without any timeout? In conducting test without JUnit =
test cases, I'm finding this timeout feature creates timeout exceptions whe=
reas running JUnit without the timeout allows my test to run successfully. =
Can anyone explain why this timeout is needed?
